Pocket Edition Alpha
Lit redstone ore has an unobtainable item form corresponding to its block ID. It can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item ID 74.
Lit redstone ore items can be obtained from the newly added debug chests, mainly from the 16th slot of the 3rd chest from the left, and the 27th slot of the 5th chest from the left.
Debug chests no longer spawn, preventing lit redstone ore items from being obtained this way.
Lit redstone ore can be obtained with the Silk Touch enchantment by breaking a block with an appropriate tool enchanted with it.
Lit redstone ore can no longer be obtained via Silk Touch.
Lit redstone ore can now be obtained as an item in singleplayer worlds via the /give command using the respective numeric ID.
The direct item form of lit redstone ore has been removed from the game. It can no longer exist as an item in any way, only as a placed block.
Lit redstone ore exists as an item.

The lit redstone ore item uses this model in inventories, when held in first person view or as a dropped item.
The lit redstone ore item uses the aforementioned model when held in third person.
The lit redstone ore item now uses this model in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
This is a result of all 3D items having changed in this version to be brighter and rotated 90 degrees clockwise from their prior appearances.
The lit redstone ore item now uses this model in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
This is a result of all 3D items having changed in this version to be even brighter than previously.
Cakes, among other irregular 3D items, no longer appear much larger than other blocks as dropped items.
The lit redstone ore item now uses this model in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
This is a result of all 3D items having changed in this version to be more shaded again.
The lit redstone ore item now uses this model in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
This is a result of all 3D items being rotated 90 degrees anticlockwise from their prior appearances.
The lit redstone ore item now uses this model in inventories, when held in first or third person view, as a dropped item or when in an item frame.
This is a result of all 3D items being brightened to a miniscule degree.
Interestingly, lit redstone ore has a distinct defined item sprite in gui_blocks.png, despite being unobtainable normally.
Lit redstone ore no longer has an item sprite.

texts.text: Item names did not exist prior to Beta 1.0.
